Method Detail

decrypt

java.lang.String decrypt(java.lang.String encryptedData)
Decrypts a LinkSmart message that has been created using the encryptAsymmetric or encryptSymmetric method.

All relevant information for decrypting the message should be included in the message itself. In the case of an error, this method returns null.

getEncodedPublicKeyByIdentifier

byte[] getEncodedPublicKeyByIdentifier(java.lang.String identifier)
                                       throws java.security.KeyStoreException
Returns the public key that is stored under a certain identifier.

Parameters:
identifier - The identifier
Returns:
The public key as a byte array or null if key could not be retrieved using the identifier
Throws:
java.security.KeyStoreException - If an exception while accessing the key store occurred.

generateCertificateWithAttributes

java.lang.String generateCertificateWithAttributes(java.lang.String xmlAttributes,
                                                   java.lang.String hid)
                                                   throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                          java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                          java.io.IOException,
                                                          java.security.KeyStoreException,
                                                          java.security.cert.CertificateException,
                                                          java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                                          java.lang.SecurityException,
                                                          java.security.SignatureException,
                                                          java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                                          java.security.NoSuchProviderException
Generates a new public/private key pair (i.e. a certificate and the corresponding private key) and writes attributes into the certificate. The certificate is then assigned to the given HID so it can be used for encrypting messages from this HID. This is the same as calling
String certRef = cryptoManager.generateCertificateWithAttributes(xmlAttributes); cryptoManager.setCertificateReference(certRef, hid);

Returns:
Returns an identifier for this key pair.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
java.io.IOException
java.security.KeyStoreException
java.security.cert.CertificateException
java.security.InvalidKeyException
java.lang.SecurityException
java.security.SignatureException
java.lang.IllegalStateException
java.security.NoSuchProviderException

getAttributesFromCertificate

java.util.Properties getAttributesFromCertificate(java.lang.String identifier)
                                                  throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                         java.security.KeyStoreException,
                                                         java.security.cert.CertificateEncodingException
Retrieves attributes that are contained within a certificate.

Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
java.security.KeyStoreException
java.security.cert.CertificateEncodingException
